resources.string: Please, enter your name before start!
Are you sure that it\'s a dessert?!
What\'s the main ingredient of air?
Nitrogen. As every twelve-year-old knows, it accounts for 78 per cent of the air.\nLess than 21 per cent of air is oxygen and only three hundredths of 1 per cent of the air is carbon dioxide.
Which of the following was the first animal to be domesticated?

Around 12,000 years ago, palaeolithic hunter-gatherers on what is now the Russian/Mongolian border learned to lure reindeer away from their huge migratory groups and breed them to create their own small herd.
What has the largest brain in comparison to its size?
The ant. An ant\'s brain is about 6 per cent of its total body weight. An average human brian weighs 1.6 kg, which is a little over 2 per cent of body weight.
What\'s the commonest material in the world?

The answer is magnesium silicate perovskite, a mineral compound of magnesium, silicon and oxygen. It accounts for about half the total mass of the planet. It\'s what the Earth\'s mantle is mostly made from.
Where is the driest place on earth?
Antarctica. Parts of the continents have seen no rain for two million years.
Which came first, the chicken or the egg?
The egg. Final answer.\nBirds evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg – laid by a reptile.
In what country is the largest part of the Nile River?
The Nile rises in Rwanda and flows through Ethiopia, Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Egypt, but the largest section traverses Sudan, despite its timeless association with Egypt.
In which of the following countries English is the official language?

There are many countries in which English is the Official Language, but England, Australia and the United States aren\’t among them. An official language is defined as a language that has been given legal status for use in a nation\’s courts, parliament and administration. In England, Australia and over half the USA, English is the unofficial language. Countries such as Canada (French and English) and Pakistan do have legally defined official languages.
Please, answer at least one question!
